name: Michael Howell From Capital Wars
title: Prospects For A Puzzling 2025
text:
Synopsis
China's economic challenges and declining marginal returns on capital are creating significant global economic shifts, with the US emerging as a more competitive economic power in the coming years.

Key Insights
- China's marginal returns on capital have dramatically dropped from around 14% to barely 5% by 2029 (projected)
- The US is now matching or potentially outperforming China in marginal returns on capital
- China's economy appears to be moving closer to debt deflation
- The global economic challenge remains how to accommodate China's economic ambitions, given its large working population
- Unusual market dynamics in 2024 include simultaneous strong performance of gold bullion and S&P500 (both around 25% gains)
- Divergent bond market trends: China's yields collapsing while US yields are rising
- The German economy is also experiencing economic challenges similar to China
